page.title: 12JARVIS TRUST
page.content: JARVIS TRUST STAUNTON ON WYE The Jarvis Trust was set up in 1790. The original charity school building was until recently a Youth Hostel and is now run as an Activities Centre with canoeing, pony trekking etc. Part of the building is still occupied by Staunton Primary School. There are 12 almshouses in 2 blocks of 6 let at a low rent to pensioners from Letton, Staunton on Wye and Bredwardine but if there is no applicant for a vacancy from one of these parishes people from other areas are taken. A resident handyman looks after paths etc. and helps residents with heavy jobs. The Store house also belongs to the trust who have their boardroom in the ground floor and let the remainder.
